intro: Hieracium tempedense, commonly known as the Italian hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as meadows and grasslands. It features yellow to orange ray florets surrounding a central disk of tubular flowers. Hieracium tempedense is often found in disturbed soils and can spread through both seeds and rhizomes.
